greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of binomial coefficients C(i+j,i) modulo 2 over all pairs (i,j) of positive integers satisfying 5i+j=n.
comment: The Le1{1,5} and Le2{5,1} triangle sums of Sierpinski’s triangle A047999 equal this sequence; see the formulas for their definitions. The Le1{1,5} and Le2{5,1} triangle sums are similar to the Kn11 and Kn21 sums, the Ca1 and Ca2 sums, and the Gi1 and Gi2 sums, see A180662.
Some A191373(2^n-p) sequences, 0<=p<=32, lead to known sequences, see the crossrefs.
link: Sam Northshield, Sums across Pascal’s triangle modulo 2, Congressus Numerantium, 200, pp. 35-52, 2010.
formula: a(2*n) = a(n) and a(2*n+1) = a(n) + a(n-2) with a(0) = 1, a(1) = 1 and a(n)=0 for n<=-1.
a(n) = Le1{1,5}(n) = sum(binomial(i + j, i) mod 2 | (i + 5*j) = n)
a(n) = Le2{5,1}(n) = sum(binomial(i + j, i) mod 2 | (5*i + j) = n)
G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = (1 + x + x^5) * A(x^2). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jul 09 2019
maple: A191373:=proc(n) option remember; if n <0 then A191373(n):=0 fi: if (n=0 or n=1) then 1 elif n mod 2 = 0 then A191373(n/2) else A191373((n-1)/2) + A191373(((n-1)/2)-2); fi; end: seq(A191373(n),n=0..75);
results.author: _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jun 05 2011
